snippet: While Google’s biggest regulatory challenge remains in Europe, authorities around the world are investigating its practices, with a report from India’s competition commission its latest problem.
abstract: Competition Commission of India becomes latest foreign antitrust regulator to highlight concerns about Google's search dominance and anticompetitive behavior; company has drawn attention from government regulators around world.

byline.original: By CONOR DOUGHERTY and MARK SCOTT

lead_paragraph: While Google’s biggest regulatory challenge remains in Europe, authorities around the world are investigating its practices, with a report from India’s competition commission its latest problem.

headline.main: Google Antitrust Inquiries Spread Over Globe, With India the Latest Problem
headline.print_headline: Google Antitrust Inquiries Spread Over Globe, With India the Latest Problem
